logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Class owning an engine establishing the rules of the game, a mapping of player to balls and a unique hole. Provides an interface to modify those resources and ensures that any modification compolies with the rules set out by the engine used.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentPlayer

        public Player getCurrentPlayer()
        Returns:
        the player whose turn it currently is. This comprises also the period during which the simulation is running following a hit.

      • getBall

        public Ball getBall(Player p)
        Parameters:
        p - a player participating in this game
        Returns:
        the ball associated with p
        Throws:
        some - exception

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Returns:
        true if the simulation is currently running (i.e. balls are moving) and no hit can be executed

      • hit

        public void hit(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 force)
        makes the current player hit the ball with force Precondition: the game is not busy
        Parameters:
        force - directed force to excert on ball

      • tick

        public void tick(float ticks)
        Advances the game by ticks units.
        Parameters:
        ticks - amount of ticks greater than 0 by which to advance the state of the game
